thread.title: UCLA’s Lonzo Ball playing through bruised hip in NCAA tournament
thread.title_full: UCLA’s Lonzo Ball playing through bruised hip in NCAA tournament

author: Jon Benne
title: UCLA’s Lonzo Ball playing through bruised hip in NCAA tournament
text:
Scary moment for the Bruins, but Ball is trying to gut it out.
The No. 3 UCLA Bruins had a scary moment on Friday night. Star freshman guard Lonzo Ball went down with a bruised hip against the No. 14 seed Kent State Golden Flashes.
Ball suffered the injury while attempting to catch a pass in midair and getting his legs cut under him. He landed hard on the side of his hip and was in obvious pain for several minutes.
Ball is still playing, though, and trying to gut out the injury. Kent State is refusing to go away, but the Bruins still have a fairly comfortable lead at the time of this writing.
One of the leading candidates to be drafted top-five in the NBA Draft, Ball might be more famous for his father’s antics, but there’s no question that he’s a game-changing talent, setting UCLA’s freshman single-season record for assists this season. The Bruins absolutely need him on the court if they’re to make a serious run at the national championship.
Because when Ball is healthy, he’s capable of awesome stuff like this.
Lonzo Ball throwing it down! pic.twitter.com/2Ajlzcouio 
— LeadingNCAA ™ (@LeadingNCAA) March 18, 2017
